intro: Neurotheca schlechteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with broad, waxy leaves that are often dark green in color. Its flowers, which come in a variety of colors, are typically borne on long, slender stalks and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Neurotheca schlechteri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
